DataElement.preferredDefinition: The date when the clinical event resolved/ended represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to clinical events._The calendar date on which something is to terminate or did terminate.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 2021-6-8 ak 12 Elevated to Standard per governance approval by RA. 11/18/18 TT released/MC.  11-19-18 TT changed max length. 11/9/18 TT changed Data Type from Character to Date and added Max Length for NCI Implementation of the standard. Created as part of CDISC mapping task. 6.21.18 mc

ReferenceDocuments.name: What was the [clinical event]
ReferenceDocuments.description: What was the [clinical event] end date?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CEENDTC
ReferenceDocuments.description: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CEENDTC in ISO 8601 format.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: The definition of resolved is sponsor specific. The preferred method is to collect a complete end date. Partial dates (e.g., providing year only or month and year only) may be acceptable.

DataElement.changeDescription: 2021-6-9 ak Released per governance approval.;  Created as part of the CDISC mapping task_ghd_08.22.18
